# Horizon scanning

## Skills description: What does the ability help you do, achieve, or produce?

This is to analyse the opportunity and risk to prepare or the future.

# Horizon Scanning

## Image: What does it look like?


## Reference: Where can we find more information or download materials?


https://www.undp.org/sites/g/files/zskgke326/files/2022-07/UNDP-RBAP-Foresight-Playbook-Appendix-2022 0.pdf

## Description: What is it? (max 1,500 characters)



Horizon scanning is  
a process of identifying and collating signals of change, including early  
warnings of change and emerging signals that may have significant impacts when  
they later develop.

## Purpose: Why do we use this method or tool for R&amp;D? (max 1,500 characters)



Horizon scanning is  
used to enable a systemic analysis of potential risks, opportunities and  
uncertainties that could affect an organizationâ€™s existing plans, programmes  
and strategies. Horizon scanning can also function as a baseline analysis in  
the planning and design of programmes by supporting risk and mitigation  
assessments.

## Summary: Describe in one sentence, what it is and what it does? (max 120 characters)



Horizon scanning is  
a foresight method for searching for signals of change of various levels of  
impact.

## Instructions: How is it used for R&amp;D? What steps to follow?



STEP 1: Collect.  
Participants are to scan news sources, blogs, think-tank publications, social  
media, academic journals, interviews or even conversations with stakeholders and  
partners to collect relevant signals. The best way to collect signals is via an  
online form.  
  
STEP 2: Collate.  
Categorize signals for further interpretation via in-person discussions, in  
Excel, shared online drives or advanced information management and data  
visualization tools such as Airtable or Notion.  
  
STEP 3: Interpretation.  
Visualize identified signals via tags or color coding to support the  
interpretation and sensemaking of signals.  
  
STEP 4: Sensemaking.  
Explore the consequences of the identified signals, and identify gaps or needed  
adjustments in current strategies in consideration of these impacts.

## Requirements: What is needed to effectively use it for R&amp;D? (e.g. skills, conditions, inputs, resources)



This tool requires participants to identify a clear scope for the horizon scanning exercise as  
well as basic digital literacy in scanning and managing online information. It  
is also important to collect inputs from a diverse group of signal scanners  
(expertise, location, age, gender etc.), who are highly curious and available  
to actively engage for the entire duration of the horizon scanning activity.

## Reflections: What to keep in mind when using the tool for R&amp;D purposes?

# Horizon scanning

## Image: What does it look like?


![](data:image/png;base64,)

## Reference: Where can we find more information or download materials?


<a href="https://www.eea.europa.eu/publications/horizon-scanning-tips#:~:text=Horizon%20scanning%20%2D%20a%20foresight%20method,future%20shocks%20and%20reduce%20uncertainty.Â  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK556423/ https://www.futuresplatform.com/blog/how-to-horizon-scanning-guideline https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201314/cmselect/cmsctech/703/70305.htm
https://quarterly.blog.gov.uk/2016/01/25/horizon-scanning-helping-policy-makers-in-an-uncertain-world/" target=" blank">https://www.eea.europa.eu/publications/horizon-scanning-tips#:~:text=Horizon%20scanning%20%2D%20a%20foresight%20method,future%20shocks%20and%20reduce%20uncertainty.Â  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK556423/ https://www.futuresplatform.com/blog/how-to-horizon-scanning-guideline https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201314/cmselect/cmsctech/703/70305.htm
https://quarterly.blog.gov.uk/2016/01/25/horizon-scanning-helping-policy-makers-in-an-uncertain-world/</a>

## Description: What is it? (max 1,500 characters)



We used horizon scanning is a strategic approach to detect weak signals and trends relating to the future of work. We consulted with youth, those in academia and private sector to identify any weak signals or trends using the PESTLE framework. We used it to find early signs of emerging trends, technologies, threats, or opportunities in the context of the digital revolution.

## Purpose: Why do we use this method or tool for R&amp;D? (max 1,500 characters)



We used horizon scanning as a strategic approach to detect  
early signs of potential developments in relation to the digital revolution in  
the context of work. It allows us to be proactive about planning for the  
future, to identify emerging trends, threats, and opportunities, yielding  
insights to allow decision-makers to anticipate changes, adapt strategies, and  
prepare for various possible outcomes. By examining information from a broad  
range of sources, in this case including our target group of youth as sources  
of insights, horizon scanning is helpful for us to stay ahead of the curve and  
provide policy advice that is in-line with how the future of work is unfolding.

## Summary: Describe in one sentence, what it is and what it does? (max 120 characters)



Horizon scanning is the systematic detection of early signs from varied sources for potential future developments.

## Instructions: How is it used for R&amp;D? What steps to follow?



For the future of work consultations, we held a consultation workshop with youth, employers and those working in academia. Participants were divided into 5 groups, and in the context of PESTLE each group is asked to identify weak signals and trends of the future of work which relates to 1 of the 5 categories in PESTLE. Following that participants were asked to vote on the most important/impactful signals from the ones identified. Each group is then focusing on the most important signal and tries to think through the implications of those signals using tools such as future wheel and issue map.

## Requirements: What is needed to effectively use it for R&amp;D? (e.g. skills, conditions, inputs, resources)



Also extended time period, to allow people we consult from to go back to their sources, consult with new sources before sharing further information on the signals that they are picking up. This is difficult to accomplish in one consultation session

## Reflections: What to keep in mind when using the tool for R&amp;D purposes?
